headline: Amazon-Funded Startup Wants To Use AI To Recreate Orson Welles' Lost Film Footage Despite Family Opposition
summary: Artificial intelligence has fueled countless breakthroughs in entertainment, but few projects have sparked as much debate as Fable's newest plan. The AI startup, funded by Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Alexa Fund, wants to recreate 43 minutes of lost footage from Orson Welles’ 1942 masterpiece “The Magnificent Ambersons” using AI, TechCrunch reported. headline: Uber Bets On Drones With Flytrex Deal To Speed Up Deliveries And Cut Costs
summary: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) partnered with Flytrex to launch its first drone delivery program, expanding Uber's logistics strategy. The U.S. ride-hailing giant gave some of its Wednesday losses after Waymo and Lyft (NASDAQ:LYFT) announced a planned expansion for 2026. The partnership begins with U.S. Uber Eats pilot markets by year-end. Also Read: Uber Q2 Earnings: Trips Surge, $20 Billion Stock Buyback, CEO Sees No Slowdown It will integrate Flytrex's FAA-certified Beyond Visual Line of Sight

headline: QUEBEC SUPERIOR COURT AUTHORIZES CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT AGAINST UBER FOR DISABILITY DISCRIMINATION
summary: The Superior Court of Quebec has officially authorized a class action lawsuit against Uber following allegations that its transportation services are not accessible to individuals with physical disabilities.  The claim, filed by Laurent Morissette, an active member of RAPLIQ (Regroupement des activistes pour l'inclusion au Québec), seeks to recognize the rights of individuals who rely on mobility aids and who have been denied access to Uber's regular services as well as its Uber WAV (wheelchair-accessible vehicle) service.  The class action aims to obtain financial compensation for those affected, as well as a judgment requiring Uber to improve its transportation practices for persons with disabilities.

raw.headline: QUEBEC SUPERIOR COURT AUTHORIZES CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT AGAINST UBER FOR DISABILITY DISCRIMINATION
raw.summary: The Superior Court of Quebec has officially authorized a class action lawsuit against Uber following allegations that its transportation services are not accessible to individuals with physical disabilities.  The claim, filed by Laurent Morissette, an active member of RAPLIQ (Regroupement des activistes pour l'inclusion au Québec), seeks to recognize the rights of individuals who rely on mobility aids and who have been denied access to Uber's regular services as well as its Uber WAV (wheelchair-accessible vehicle) service.  The class action aims to obtain financial compensation for those affected, as well as a judgment requiring Uber to improve its transportation practices for persons with disabilities.
